fields.title: Join us for Samvera Virtual Connect May 6th-7th: Schedule and Free Registration Now Available

content.value: You're invited to join us for Samvera Virtual Connect, May 6th - 7th, 2025
This free online event brings together repository managers, developers, technologists, and anyone looking to learn more about
Avalon Media System
Hyku
Hyrax
, and related technologies under the
Samvera Community
umbrella.
Both daily sessions will include presentations, case studies, discussions, and Q&A opportunities --
see the full schedule
on the Samvera Community wiki.
Details
Samvera Virtual Connect, May 6th - 7th, 2025
See the full schedule on the Samvera Community wiki
Register today
The conference will be held entirely online via Zoom​ meeting mode, and all presentations will be recorded for those who cannot attend live.
​We can't wait to see you there!

fields.title: Join Our May Community Sprints – Everyone’s Welcome!

content.value: We’re excited to invite you to Samvera’s upcoming
Community Sprints

this May! These virtual sprints bring people together to enhance code and documentation. Whether you're a developer, metadata specialist, repository administrator, or in any other role, there’s a place for you to contribute.
Upcoming Sprints
Documentation Sprint

(May 12–16)
Led by the Documentation Working Group, this sprint focuses on improving FAQs, installation guides, functionality descriptions, and more. Whether you’re an experienced writer or new to documentation, your input will help make resources clearer and more accessible.
Sign up for the Documentation Sprint
Development Sprint

(May 19–23)
Join the Product Owners and Tech Leads of Avalon, Hyku, and Hyrax to work on high-priority community features. This is a great opportunity to contribute code, learn from experienced developers, and collaborate on impactful projects.
Sign up for the Development Sprint
Whether you can join for a day or the full week, your participation makes a difference!

fields.title: New Roles to Strengthen the Hyku Community

content.value: The Sustaining the Hyku Repository Platform Steering Group—a collaborative effort led by the Private Academic Library Network of Indiana (PALNI) and the Partnership for Academic Library Collaboration & Innovation (PALCI) in partnership with the Samvera Community—is excited to announce grant support for two recently defined Hyku community positions.
Nic Don Stanton-Roark
has been named Hyku Product Owner, and
Tracy McCormick
is the new Hyku Community Developer. Defined by the Hyku user community as part of the
Sustaining the Hyku Repository Platform

project, these roles are supported by the Institute of Museum and Library Services (IMLS) under grant number LG-256726-OLS-24. They will enhance Hyku’s development and long-term sustainability as an open-source, multi-tenant repository solution.
Read more and get to know Nic Don and Tracy
on the Hyku for Consortia blog.
